messages.content: ComfyUI PhotoMaker is an unofficial implementation of the PhotoMaker project for ComfyUI, allowing users to generate images and videos using a stable diffusion model.
What features are included in ComfyUI PhotoMaker?
Features include base model loading, PhotoMaker Adapter model loading, reference image preprocessing, Lora model loading, prompt + style, and PhotoMaker generation.
How can I install ComfyUI PhotoMaker?

You can manually install ComfyUI PhotoMaker by running commands cd custom_nodes, git clone https://github.com/ZHO-ZHO-ZHO/ComfyUI-PhotoMaker.git, cd custom_nodes/ComfyUI-PhotoMaker, pip install -r requirements.txt, and then restarting ComfyUI.
What are the supported styles in ComfyUI PhotoMaker?
The supported styles in ComfyUI PhotoMaker include no style, cinematic, Disney character, digital art, photographic (default), fantasy art, neonpunk, enhance, comic book, lowpoly, and line art.
What are the supported file formats for the reference images in ComfyUI PhotoMaker?

The reference images can be any image format that is supported by the operating system and the used programming library, as image pre-processing only requires the image to be read and possibly resized. Direct input can be done using a single image file path, and the software will automatically select the first file it encounters. Path input means to place the images to generate within a directory.
What is the default guidance scale in ComfyUI PhotoMaker?
The default guidance scale in ComfyUI PhotoMaker is 5.
